Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is spotted with a grey-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394518) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394518)
